intro: Dorstenia yambuyaensis, commonly known as the Yambuya dwarf banana, is a rare and unique plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, and often twisted leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
